questions.question: What is the chemical formula for MFM-180?
At what temperature were the single crystal diffraction datasets for MFM-180, MFM-181, and MFM-182 collected?
What method was used for the framework activation of MFM-180 and MFM-181?
questions.answer: Heated at 100 °C under dynamic vacuum for 16 h

questions.question: What is the BET surface area of MFM-185a as determined from N2 adsorption at 77 K?
What is the working capacity for CH4 at 298 K, 5-65 bar for MFM-185a?
Does MFM-180a show selectivity for CO2 over CH4?
questions.answer: Yes, it shows a selectivity for CO2 over CH4

questions.question: Is the CO2/CH4 selectivity for MFM-180a around 4?
questions.answer: Yes, the CO2/CH4 selectivity for MFM-180a is around 4

questions.question: What is the heat of adsorption for CO2 at zero coverage in MFM-180a?
What is the crystal system and space group for MFM-183?
Was MFM-184 successfully synthesized?
questions.answer: No, MFM-184 was analyzed in silico based upon the isoreticular nature of this series of materials

questions.question: What is the predicted BET surface area for MFM-184a based on simulations?
Does the series MFM-180 to MFM-185 show an increase in porosity and BET surface area?
questions.answer: Yes, there is an increase in porosity and BET surface area from MFM-180 to MFM-185

questions.question: What is the role of the [Cu2(O2CR)4] paddlewheel in the structure of MFM-18X series?
questions.answer: It acts as a node connecting the octacarboxylate linkers to form the 3D open structures

questions.question: What strategy was used to modulate the porosity in the MFM-18X series?
Is the rotational dynamics of molecular rotors within MFM-180 and MFM-181 controlled by ligand design?
questions.answer: Yes, the rotational dynamics of molecular rotors within MFM-180 and MFM-181 are controlled by ligand design
